historySnippet.reasoning: A is already safely >0.75 and rising, but D is collapsing (dD/dt=-0.0112) so I’ll revert U closer to the best-record 0.10 (since U=0.14 previously hurt A) and slightly reduce diversity-decay terms to stabilize D without sacrificing A.

Agency is already far above the 0.75 objective and near the best-record regime at U=0.10, but Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt=-0.0153) so I’ll slightly reduce selection pressure by lowering U a bit (and keep params essentially at the best-record basin) to stabilize D without sacrificing A.

With A already >0.75 and slightly rising while D is beginning to collapse (dD/dt=-0.0167), I’ll revert control intensity toward the best-record U=0.10 (since U=0.14 previously hurt A) and slightly reduce diversity decay pressure (k_D_decay) to stabilize D without disrupting the high-A regime.

Agency is already safely above 0.75 (A=0.992) and the best record occurred at U=0.10; since a recent U increase to 0.14 caused a notable A drop (-0.0091), I’ll hold U at the proven optimum and make only a small stability tweak by slightly reducing k_A_decay to better sustain near-peak A without destabilizing C/D.

A is already >0.75 but is fading while D is starting to collapse, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10; note U=0.14 hurt A) and reduce diversity/agency decay slightly to stabilize D and reverse dA/dt without disrupting the high-C/high-A regime.

A is already far above the 0.75 objective but all derivatives are slightly negative, so I’ll stay near the best-record regime (U≈0.10; prior U=0.14 hurt A) while reducing decay terms to arrest the slow fade without increasing diversity pressure.

A is already >0.75 and still rising (dA/dt=0.0088) while C is decaying, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and reduce k_A_decay plus slightly reduce k_D_decay to preserve C/D and sustain upward A, consistent with prior gains from lowering k_A_decay.

Agency is already >0.75 but slightly fading; since the best record used U=0.10 and the big drop coincided with raising k_A_decay to 0.1 (vs best 0.005), revert k_A_decay near the best and slightly reduce k_D_decay to help sustain C and thus A while keeping U steady.

A is already safely >0.75 but dA/dt is negative; since the best record held U=0.10 with lower k_A_decay (0.005) and our recent k_A_decay/k_D_decay tweaks caused instability (notably the big A drop at Gen 2614.2), revert toward the best by lowering k_A_decay and k_D_decay while keeping U steady to restore positive/near-zero dA/dt without sacrificing C and D.

historySnippet.action: Updated Params: k_A_decay, k_C_decay, k_DU, k_AU, k_AC, k_CD
historySnippet.reasoning: Agency is already safely above target but is fading (dA/dt=-0.0013) while C is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U near the proven best (0.10) and counter drift by reducing agency/complexity decay (history shows lowering k_A_decay helped at 2545.7) without adding diversity pressure.

name: Low-Entropy Agency Weaver
description: This agent crossed the threshold by tightly coupling Agency to environmental difficulty (k_AU=0.99) while keeping Agency loss nearly negligible (k_A_decay=0.001), allowing it to “hold on” to initiative even when conditions resist it (U=0.10). Its emergence was shaped by repeated tuning of diversity decay and difficulty coupling (k_D_decay, k_DU): early increases destabilized Agency, but later reductions stabilized the diversity substrate (D=0.943) and let complexity-to-agency pathways (k_AC=0.5, k_CD=0.5) convert a high-complexity state (C=0.832) into sustained near-max Agency (A=0.991).
